title: 109_hr5939
content: The Act may be cited as the "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" and includes provisions related to terrorist offenses resulting in death. SEC. 2 of the "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" introduces a new offense, Sec. 2339E, which punishes individuals who cause death while committing a terrorist offense with death penalty or imprisonment. The term 'terrorist offense' is defined broadly to include various felony offenses and attempts or conspiracies to commit such offenses. SEC. 3 introduces the death penalty for specific terrorist offenses resulting in death, amending various sections of the United States Code to include death as a punishment option. SEC. 4 increases penalties for certain offenses by amending the United States Code to extend prison terms. SEC. 5 updates the state of mind requirement for specific offenses, and SEC. 6 addresses providing material support to terrorist groups. SEC. 5 amends Section 2339C of title 18, US Code, by replacing "unlawfully and wilfully" with "knowingly". SEC. 6 increases penalties for providing material support to terrorists and receiving military-type training from a foreign terrorist organization. SEC. 7 denies federal benefits to convicted terrorists. SEC. 7 amends Chapter 113B of title 18, US Code to deny Federal benefits to individuals convicted of Federal crimes of terrorism. Section 2516(q) of title 18, United States Code, is amended to include "chapter 113B" instead of "section 2332" through "2339C". Section 2339D of title 18, United States Code, is amended to include attempts or conspiracies to receive after "receives".
